text:
Central Park: The Obelisk, located in the easterly portion, near the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Circa 1890

Mildenburg, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection

315G
LOCAL HISTORY
AND GENEALOGY
title: General view - Manhattan - Central Park - The Obelisk.

text:
(1)
Central Park: The Obelisk, or "Cleopatra's Needle", seen through the trees from the east side of the abandoned Lower Reservoir, with the Carlyle apartment building, at Madison Avenue and 76th Street, in the background.
P. L. Sperr.
June 28, 1931.

(2)
The Obelisk, a closer view, and more towards the north.
P. L. Sperr.
June 28, 1931.

(3)
The Obelisk known as Cleopatra's Needle which was given to the United States by the Khedive of Egypt in 1877 and set on its base on this site on January 22, 1881; the cornerstone being laid, October 9, 1880. It originally stood in Cairo in front of the Temple of the Sun, having been erected about 1500 B.C. by Thothmes III. In 12 B.C. it was removed to Alexandria by Augustus Caesar. Wm. H. Vanderbilt supplied the funds necessary for its transportation to this country.
About 1890.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: General view - Manhattan - Central Park - The Obelisk.

text:
Central Park. Arrival of Cleopatra's Needle.
No record of photography
no date
title: General view - Manhattan - Central Park - Arrival of Cleopatra's Needle (Obelisk).

text:
Central Park where the Obelisk is erected is one of the most beautiful and most famous of the urban parks in the world. It covers the territory between Fifth and Eighth Avenues, and 59th and 110th Streets a track over 2 1/2 miles long, by half a mile wide, including an area of 840 acres. The Obelisk or Cleopatra's Needle is placed to the east of the Reservoir and Metropolitan Museum of Art.

No Record of Photography

315G
LOCAL HISTORY
AND GENEALOGY
title: General view - Manhattan - Central Park - Where the Obelisk is erected.
